Articles.Content: As I recall, the air is perfectly breathable, its just the pollen and other stuff in it that the kerbals are fatally allergic to after living on filtered shipboard air for generations. So I would guess that over time they will become desensitized and those allergies will become less of a problem. Think hayfever rather than anaphalactic shock.

That's what I think as well makes sense. Anyway any eta on the next chapter I love this story!

Edited November 14, 2013 by tiger336
is this dead?...please not let it be dead...

is this dead?...please not let it be dead...

I hope that it is not dead as well
Its not dead! He just uploaded a chapter!

Oh no, it's most certainly not dead! I just can't write, edit and proofread each chapter in mere days is all.

The next one's about half done already though.

Its not dead! He just uploaded a chapter!

Yup. Take it easy folks. That last chapter was like all the others in this fine story - a pretty big chunk of text. It takes time to even write those, never mind proofreading and revisions. Especially if you're doing it in your spare time.
WUT? Already? You take a long while to upload chapters, and that may be a good thing.

Oh no, it's most certainly not dead! I just can't write, edit and proofread each chapter in mere days is all.

The next one's about half done already though.

I know how that is, speaking of which I need to proof-read my next chapter

back on topic, great work as always
Should you need someone to help you proofread, you just have to ask.
Bump. How is development going
Indeed. We would all like to know how development is going.

*Pushes thread"

Okay folks! Line up for the greatest read you ever had!
Where'd this go? Just wondering, this stuff was REALLY good!

Still in progress. Been writing here and there on the next chapter, but it's difficult going at the moment. I'm working through some kinks in the story line that I want to ensure are straightened out properly. It won't do to be introducing huge loopholes and pretend like nothing's amiss.

I am not JJ Abrams, nor Michael Bay!

Part III of Slaves to the Kraath is up!

No images to add to this one (yet), but I've been beating myself silly with Blender in an attempt to get some pose-able kerbal models working toward that end.

I'm the absolute worst with texturing, not to mention more organic concepts like hair, despite having waded through lots of tutorials. It'll take some time, but I'm putting focus back into the writing for a little bit to take a break from that particular madness.

Fantastic - this is still one of my favourite stories on here. I love your imagining of kerbal society, the way you use bits of their language here and there and generally the way they feel so darn alien.
Absolutely brilliant chapter, it really does seem like grade A+++ material you're writing. I'm really looking forward to the pictures, I can only imagine the look of what they might be!

Hey thanks a bunch for the feedback!

Chapter 8 is already started, too. I can't promise an ETA, but the delay to completion shouldn't be as long as the last one. That is, assuming I don't suddenly have some major epiphany that has me realizing a means of animating this whole thing outright, instead!

(Don't worry. Though that's extremely unlikely, I wouldn't leave everybody hanging and wondering wtf is happening!)

Okay, so the perfect storm of free time, ideas and coffee all came together and conspired to let me roll out another chapter in very short order.

Y'all enjoy, I'ma gonna go rest the fingertips for a spell.

Strangely quiet around here regarding the last one...

Too focused on characters, not enough action perhaps? Keep your clicking fingers limber; the action returns next chapter.

Chapter 9 - Black Shoal is now up!

Enjoy!

Edited March 14, 2014 by Deadweasel

Didn't even spot Chapter 9 the first time around That oversight has now been corrected!

I thought Chapter 9 was very well done and a good closing out of some of the Kraath material. I've always liked the character driven parts of this story, so speaking personally, 'too focused on characters' is very unlikely to be a comment that I'll make. With that said - action is good and woah you weren't kidding about it coming back in Chapter 10!

If any newcomers to the thread are reading this - go read Chapter 10. Do that now. Then read the whole story from the prologue onwards - you'll want to. Then read Chapter 10 again.

Edited March 14, 2014 by KSK
I only see chapter 9 where is 10?

I only see chapter 9 where is 10?

I derp'd. There is no chapter 10 (yet), but for some reason that's what I typed in the announcement post yesterday >_<
